definition[0]: to make sure that something is actually true, correct, or acceptable
example[0]: I made a phone call to check out his address.
example[1]: Check it out with your boss before you do anything.
definition[1]: if information checks out, it is proved to be true, correct, or acceptable
definition[2]: to look at someone or something because they are interesting or attractive
example[3]: If I hear about a website that sounds interesting, I check it out.
definition[3]: to get information about someone, especially to find out if they are suitable for something
example[5]: I’ll check them out as potential employers.
definition[4]: to leave a hotel after paying the bill
definition[5]: to borrow a book from a library
example[7]: The library allows you to check out six books at a time.
definition[6]: to make sure that something is true, correct, or safe
example[8]: I checked out the financial aspects of buying into the company.
definition[7]: if information or a document checks out, it proves to be correct or true
example[9]: If your credit limit checks out, you can make a purchase today.
example[10]: You’ve got to check out by 12:00.
